member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.MemberPart.GetPort(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.TopologyGeometryType,System.Int32,System.Int32,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.ContextTypes,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a specific port on the given entity with the given port moniker data. Use the flag createPort to get a port with geometry to be created by a later operation. The port is needed to complete a connection. Typical use is for creating a physical connection with port geometry to be provided by an end cut operation.
member.param: Operation ID in which to create the port.
Flag to create a port with the given moniker data in case a port is not found.
member.returns: Structure port created by the given moniker data.
member.example:
GetPort method example code.
Dim port As TopologyPort = memberPart.GetPort(TopologyGeometryType.Face, 0, 0, ContextTypes.Base, CInt(SectionFaceType.Bottom_Flange_Left), True)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.MemberPart.GetPort(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.TopologyGeometryType,System.Int32,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.ContextTypes,System.Int32,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GeometryStage,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a specific port on the given entity with the given port moniker data. Use the flag createPort to get a port with geometry that will be created by a later operation. The port is needed to establish a connection. Typical use is to get the related initial port or stable port.
member.param: ID on the subport. Also, type of the section face.
Flag to create a port with the given moniker data in case the port is not found.
member.returns: Struct port created by the given moniker data.
member.exception: Raised if the geometry type is not within the TopologyGeometryType enumerator range.
Raised when more than one port meet the given criteria.
member.example:
This is an example for using the GetPort method.
'Create a member system. Dim memberSystem As MemberSystem 'Get the member part from the member system. Dim memberPart As MemberPart Dim facePort As TopologyPort = memberPart.GetPort(TopologyGeometryType.Face, -1, ContextTypes.Lateral, CInt(SectionFaceType.Bottom), GeometryStage.Current, True)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.MemberPart.GetPort(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a port with given feature operation and segment ID from the feature. If the createPort argument is true, it will create a late binding port; i.e., a port without current geometry. Typical use is to get face/edge late binding ports after the end cut is applied.
member.param: Flag to create a port with given data in case the port is not found.
member.returns: Struct port created by the given moniker data.
member.exception: Raised when an argument is null.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.MemberPart.GetPort(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.TopologyGeometryType,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.ContextTypes)
member.summary: Gets a base or offset port with the given topology geometry type from the given entity. Operation ID, operator ID, and section face ID are ignored for filtering ports.
member.returns: Base or offset port based on the given inputs. Null if no port is available on the entity with the given inputs.
member.exception: Raised if context type is not base or offset.
Raised if the geometry type is not within the TopologyGeometryType enumerator range.
Raised when there is failure to find the port.
Raised when more than one port meets the given criteria.
member.example:
GetPort method example code.
'Create a member system. Dim memberSystem As MemberSystem
'Get the member part from the member system. Dim memberPart As MemberPart Dim baseOrOffsetPort As TopologyPort = memberPart.GetPort(TopologyGeometryType.Face, ContextTypes.Base)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.MemberPart.GetPort(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.TopologyGeometryType,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.ContextTypes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a specific port with the given topology geometry type, context, and section face identifier from the given entity. Operation ID and operator ID are ignored for filtering ports.
member.param: The section face identifier (subport ID) associated with the structure port moniker.
member.returns: A port based on the given inputs. Null if no port is available on the entity with the given inputs.
member.exception: Raised if the geometry type is not within the TopologyGeometryType enumerator range.
Raised when there is failure to find the port.
Raised when more than one port meets the given criteria.
member.example:
GetPort method example code.
'Create a member system. Dim memberSystem As MemberSystem
'Get the member part from the member system. Dim memberPart As MemberPart Dim port As TopologyPort = memberPart.GetPort(TopologyGeometryType.Face, ContextTypes.Base, CInt(SectionFaceType.Top_Flange_Left))

member.name: T:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.SharedParameter
member.summary: Shared parameter is a geometric construction that provides a parameter value for other geometric constructions. No geometry is persisted. It consists only of a parameter value.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.SharedParameter.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.PrivateBusinessObject)
member.summary: Constructor for .NET to access this class.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.SharedParameter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a transient geometric construction shared parameter occurrence with the geometric construction type name.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurred while creating a geometric construction by type name.

Raised if geometric construction type name is not available in the catalog and disk.
Raised if geometric construction type name is not valid in which to create a geometric construction of type SharedParameter.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a transient geometric construction shared parameter occurrence with the geometric construction type name.
Dim geometricConstructionTypeName As String = "ParamBoolean"
Dim booleanSharedParameter As New SharedParameter(geometricConstructionTypeName)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.SharedParameter.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a persistent geometric construction shared parameter occurrence under the given parent system and geometric construction type name.
member.param: The parent system under which to create the geometric construction shared parameter.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurred while creating a geometric construction by type name.

Raised if geometric construction type name is not available in the catalog and disk.
Raised if geometric construction type name is not valid in which to create a geometric construction of type SharedParameter.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a persistent geometric construction shared parameter occurrence under the given parent system and geometric construction type name.
'Get the parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim geometricConstructionTypeName As String = "ParamDouble"
Dim doubleSharedParameter As New SharedParameter(rootSystem, geometricConstructionTypeName)

member.summary: ComputedInput class is used to declare computed input field variables in a custom GeometricConstructionDefinition class. These field variables must be preceded by the ComputedInputAttribute. A computed input is evaluated internally during the Evaluate method. member.name: T:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature
member.summary: The Feature object is used to remove or add material from a profile part or plate part geometry. A feature can be a stand-alone feature, which is directly placed by the user, such as an edge feature, corner feature, web corner cope, surface trim, etc. Also a feature can be created by an assembly connection rule, such as a web cut, flange cut, slot, chamfer, etc.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.PrivateBusinessObject)
member.summary: Constructor for .NET to access this class.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a slot feature using a penetrated part and penetrating part.
member.param: The parent system under which to create the slot feature.
The penetrated part that can be a detailed plate part base or stiffener part base.
The penetrating part that can be a detailed plate part base or stiffener part base.
The root selector or part name in the catalog.
member.exception: Raised if the argument is null.
Raised when the parent system is not in working status.
Raised when the user does not have permission to access or modify the parent system object.
Raised when the database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
Raised if the penetrated part is other than plate part base or stiffener part base.
Raised if the penetrating part is other than plate part base or stiffener part base.
Raised if the penetrated part or penetrating part is not detailed.
Raised when an intersection does not exist between the penetrated part and penetrating part.
Raised if a valid part is not found under the given root selection.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a slot feature using penetrated part and penetrating part.
'Get the parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim parentSystem As New StructuralSystem(rootSystem)
Dim penetratedPart As BusinessObject 'Substitute this line with the actual detailed plate part base or stiffener part base instance. Dim penetratingPart As BusinessObject 'Substitute this line with the actual detailed plate part base or stiffener part base instance which is geometrically intersected with the penetrated part.
Dim slotFeature As New Feature(parentSystem, penetratedPart, penetratingPart, "RootSlot")

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.IPort,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.FeatureType,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates an edge feature/water stop at the intersection point between the intersecting port and the given edge port.
It can be used to create a chamfer/web cut between the bounded and bounding port.
Also it can be used to create a trim/general cut-out feature using a bounded port from the member part and surface port from a bounding object depending upon the given feature type.
member.param: The parent system under which to create the chamfer/web cut, edge feature/water stop, or trim/general cut-out.
The bounded port to create chamfer/web cut; the detailed part edge port in which to create the edge feature/water stop; the member part axis port in which to create the trim/general cut-out.

The bounding object, which can be a plane, point, or face port in which to create the chamfer/web cut; the intersecting surface lateral port in which to create the edge feature/water stop; the bounding object surface in which to create the trim/general cut-out.
Enumerated values for the feature type. WebCut/Chamfer, Edge/WaterStop, or Trim/GeneralCutOut are valid input.
The root selection string from which begins the selection rule execution.
member.exception: Raised when the argument is null.
Raised when the argument is not valid.
Raised when the feature is not valid.
Raised when a connection cannot be obtained from the parent system.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the root class for specific feature type.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the root smart class name.
Raised when unable to find the valid part under the given root selection.
Raised when the port type is not valid.
Raised when the feature type is not valid.
Raised when the port connectable is not a part.
Raised when the port connectable is not detailed.
Raised when the port connectable is a straked part.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while computing the sketching plane and curve for the edge feature.
Raised when the feature is not valid.
Raised when the value is not a free edge.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while validating the edge port for water stop.
Raised when an invalid edge port is used to create the water stop.
Raised when an invalid port context type is used.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while finding the operator for operation in the graph.
Raised when the two port connectables are the same.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while finding the closest points between two bodies.
Raised when the intersecting port is not intersecting with the edge port.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the closest point on the wire.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the normal from the position.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the edge feature or water stop.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the molded form naming rule count.
Raised when unexpected error occurred while getting the naming rule solver.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the molded form naming rule name.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting or setting naming rules.
Raised when a bounded port is not valid.
Raised when a bounding port is not valid.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the web cut feature.
Raised when the penetrating object is not detailed.
Raised when the bounded and bounding ports are not connected.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the chamfer feature.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the trim feature.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the smart item definition.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the object using a ProgID.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the references collection.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while setting the references collection argument.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the item from the collection helper.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while removing the references collection from the collection helper.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while adding the references collection to the collection helper.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while adding new relation with the references collection.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the relations collection.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while removing all arguments from the references collection.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while setting the root section on the occurrence.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting valid objects from the feature input helper.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while setting parent objects on the feature.
Raised when the feature does not support this operation.
Raised when the object is not a name rule object.
Raised when the user does not have access to read or modify the feature.
Raised when an invalid molded form name rule is used.
member.example:
This is an example of a feature constructor to create an edge feature/water stop on the given edge port and intersection point between the intersecting port and the given edge port.
'Get the parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim parentSystem As New StructuralSystem(rootSystem)
'Get the free detailed edge port from plate part/stiffener part. Dim edgePort As TopologyPort = detailedDeckPlatePart.GetPort(TopologyGeometryType.Edge, -1, 1, ContextTypes.Base, -1)
'Get the intersecting face lateral port from a detailed plate part. Dim intersectingPort As TopologyPort = detailedIntersectingTBH.GetPort(TopologyGeometryType.Face, -1, 1, ContextTypes.Lateral, -1)
Dim edgeFeature As New Feature(parentSystem, edgePort, intersectingPort, FeatureType.Edge, "CutEdge")
'Now we will create a chamfer or web cut on the given bounded and bounding port.
'Get the port from profile part. Dim boundedPort As IPort = Nothing
'Get the bounding object (can be a plane or point or face port). Dim boundingPort As BusinessObject = Nothing
Dim webCutFeature As New Feature(parentSystem, boundedPort, boundingPort, FeatureType.WebCut, "WebCuts")
'Now we will create a trim or general cut-out feature using bounded port from member part and surface port from bounding object.
'Get the penetrated object as member part axis port. Dim boundedPortFromMemberPart As MemberPartAxisPort = Nothing
'Get the bounding object as surface port from wall, up to which the bounded port will be trimmed. Dim surfacePortFromBoundingObject As BusinessObject = Nothing
Dim trimFeature As New Feature(parentSystem, boundedPortFromMemberPart, surfacePortFromBoundingObject, "SurfaceTrim_1")

Web cut or flange cut feature in which to create the chamfer.

member.example:
This is an example of a feature constructor to create a chamfer feature on an existing end cut.
'Get the parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim parentSystem As New StructuralSystem(rootSystem)

Dim edgeIdToChamfer As Integer = 8193 Dim rootSelectorOrPart As String = "ManualSingleSidedBase"
Dim flangeCutFeature As New Feature(parentSystem, webCut, edgeIdToChamfer, rootSelectorOrPart)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.IDetailable,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.ContextTypes,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to place a corner feature on detailed parts. Currently this constructor supports placement of a corner feature only on the collar parts. The section IDs are used to get the corresponding late ports required to locate the corner.
member.param: The detailed part on which to create the corner feature.
The context ID of the face port of the detailed part. This should be of either base or offset ContextType.
The section ID of the port along U-direction.
The section ID of the port along V-direction.
member.exception: Raised if the argument is null.
Raised when the user does not have permission to access or modify the parent system object.
Raised when a physical connection is not in working status.
Raised when a connection cannot be obtained from the parent system.
Raised if a valid part is not found under the given root selection.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurred while getting the late ports of the collar part.
Raised if the detailed part is other than the collar part.
Raised if the part is not valid or if the selection rule did not return any valid selections when executing the selection rule with the given root selector.
Raised when the faceContextType, sectionIdAlongU, or sectionIdAlongV is not valid.
member.example:
This is an example of a feature constructor to create a corner feature on collar part.
'Place a Stiffener or ER part penetrating through plate, stiffener, or ER part. 'Split the penetrated part with penetrating part and detail both of them to get the collar part. 'Get the collar part. Dim collarPart As CollarPart = Nothing 'Get the face port the face port of the detailed part. Dim faceContextTypes As ContextTypes = ContextTypes.Base 'Get the section ID of the port along U-direction. Dim sectionIdAlongU As int = 513 'Get the section ID of the port along V-direction to locate the collar corner. Dim sectionIdAlongV As int = 258 Dim cornerFeature As New Feature(collarPart, faceContextTypes, sectionIdAlongU, sectionIdAlongV, "RootCorner")

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.TopologyPort,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.TopologyPort,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a corner feature on a corner formed by a slot feature where it intersects with the original edge of the part. The face port defines the sketching plane. The other port and a segment of the slot are used to define the curves in the sketching plane that are used to refine the shape. The order of these inputs are important in an ambiguous case; i.e., there are two different corners formed by the same inputs.
member.param: The adjacent face port along U-direction.
The edge ID of the slot feature along V-direction.
The root selection string from which will begin the selection rule execution.
member.exception: Raises if the arguments are null.
Raised when the input is not valid to create a corner feature.
Raised when a connection cannot be obtained from the parent system.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the corner feature.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the molded form naming rule count.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the naming rule solver.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the molded form naming rule name.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting or setting naming rules.
member.example:
This is an example of a feature constructor to create a corner feature on member parts, stiffener parts, and plate parts.
'Place a Stiffener or ER part penetrating through plate, stiffener, or ER part. 'Split the penetrated part with penetrating part and detail both of them to get the slot.
'Get the slot feature. Dim slot As Feature = Nothing
'Get the face port from a detailed stiffener part. Dim facePort As TopologyPort = Nothing

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.TopologyPort,System.Int32,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.TopologyPort,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a corner feature on a corner formed by a slot feature where it intersects with the original edge of the part. The face port defines the sketching plane. The segment of the feature and another port are used to define the curves in the sketching plane that are used to refine the shape. The order of these inputs are important in an ambiguous case; i.e., there are two different corners formed by the same inputs.
member.param: The edge ID of the slot feature along U-direction.
The adjacent face port along V-direction.
The root selection string from which will begin the selection rule execution.
member.exception: Raises if the arguments are null.
Raised when the input is not valid to create a corner feature.
Raised when a connection cannot be obtained from the parent system.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the corner feature.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the molded form naming rule count.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the naming rule solver.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting the molded form naming rule name.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting or setting naming rules.
member.example:
This is an example of a feature constructor to create a corner feature on member parts, stiffener parts, and plate parts.
'Place a Stiffener or ER part penetrating through plate, stiffener, or ER part. 'Split the penetrated part with penetrating part and detail both of them to get the slot.
'Get the slot feature. Dim slot As Feature = Nothing
'Get the face port from a detailed stiffener part. Dim facePort As TopologyPort = Nothing
'Specify the edgeID to locate the slot corner Dim edgeIDAlongU Integer = CInt(SectionFaceType.Web_Left)
'Get the connected port from a detailed stiffener part. Dim adjacentFacePortAlongV As TopologyPort = Nothing
Dim cornerFeature As New Feature(slot, facePort, edgeIDAlongU, adjacentFacePortAlongV, "RootCorner")

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature.GetBoundingPlateFlangeClearance(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.IPort,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.IPort)
member.summary: Gets the clearance between the corners of the stiffener and the edge of a plate port that bounds the stiffener. A positive clearance means the boundary is larger than the stiffener at each flange corner. A negative clearance means at least one flange corner is off the edge of the plate.
member.param: The bounded port of stiffener part.
The bounding port of plate part.
member.exception: Unexpected failure occurred while getting the connected port from edge feature.

example.code: Dim boundingPlate As PlateSystem 'Replace this line with a plate system constructor call Dim boundedStiffener As StiffenerSystem 'Replace this line with a stiffener system constructor call. boundedStiffener.Detail() Dim webcut As Feature 'Replace this line with the code to get the feature from the detailed stiffener. Dim boundedPort As BusinessObject = Nothing Dim boundingPort As BusinessObject = Nothing webCut.GetInputs(boundedPort, boundingPort) Dim clearance As Double = Feature.BoundingPlateFlangeClearance(DirectCast(boundedPort, IPort), DirectCast(boundingPort, IPort))

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature.ExecuteSelectionRule(System.String)

member.param: The root selector or part name in the catalog.
member.returns: If the input value is a part name the return value is the same part. If the input value is a part class that has an associated selection rule, the return value is the first part selected by the selection rule. If the input value is an empty string, the return value is the first part selected by the selection rule based on the objectâ€™s current root selector.
member.exception: Raised if the rootSelectorOrPart argument is null.
Raised when unable to find a valid part under the given root selection. An invalid part is a part that is not a child of the root smart class hierarchy.

member.example:

Dim feature as Feature 'Substitute this line with the actual feature instance. Dim selectionRule As String = feature.ExecuteSelectionRule("RootEdge")

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature.GetHeightAbovePenetratingObject(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Plate,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.ProfileSystem)
member.summary: Gets the height to the edge of the penetrated object that is above the penetrating object. Penetrated object can be a plate system. Penetrating object can be a stiffener system or an edge reinforcement system.
member.exception: Raised if the penetrated object is not a plate system.
Raised if the intersection between the penetrated and penetrating object is not a point;
member.para: Or when an unexpected error occurs while getting the height above the penetrating object;
Or while getting the adjacent or opposite ports of the mounting face for the penetrating object;
Or when the intersection between the penetrating plane and penetrated object is not a line.
member.example:
This is an example of the GetHeightAbovePenetratingObject method to get the height above the penetrated plate.
'Create a deck plate system. Dim deckPlateSystem As Plate = Nothing 'Create a bulkhead bounded to the deck plate system. Dim bulkheadPlateSystem As Plate = Nothing 'Create a stiffener system on the deck such that it penetrates the bulkhead. Dim stiffenerSystem As ProfileSystem = Nothing
'Get the height of the bulkhead above the penetrated stiffener. Feature.GetHeightAbovePenetratingObject(bulkheadPlateSystem, stiffenerSystem)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.AssemblyConnection.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.FrameConnection,System.String)
member.summary: Creates assembly connection object using the connection information from the given frame connection.
member.param: The parent system under which the assembly connection will be created.
The root selector or part name.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when a valid catalog part could not be selected by the selector rule for the given frame connection.
Raised when unable to get a valid assembly connection part.
Raised when the database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
Raised when the root selector is not valid.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while executing the selection rule.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the assembly connection.
Raised when a connection already exists.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create an assembly connection using a frame connection.
'Get the parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim parentSystem As New StructuralSystem(rootSystem)
'Get the frame connection from member system created with related objects. Dim frameConnection As FrameConnection = memberSystem.FrameConnection(MemberAxisEnd.End)
Dim assemblyConnection As New AssemblyConnection(parentSystem, frameConnection, "FrameAsmConnections")

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.AssemblyConnection.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.FrameConnection,Ingr.SP3D.ReferenceData.Middle.Part)
member.summary: Creates assembly connection object using the connection information from the given frame connection and assembly connection part. The selection rule will always select the same input part.
member.param: The parent system under which the assembly connection needs to be created.
The catalog part for the assembly connection.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when unable to get a valid assembly connection part.
Raised when the database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the assembly connection.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while setting the part.
Raised when a connection already exists.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create an assembly connection using a frame connection and an assembly connection catalog part.
'Get the parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim parentSystem As New StructuralSystem(rootSystem) Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper()
'Get the frame connection from member system created with related objects. Dim frameConnection As FrameConnection = memberSystem.FrameConnection(MemberAxisEnd.End)
'Get the assembly connection part. Dim part As Part = DirectCast(catalogStructHelper.GetPart("BasePlateAsmConn_1"), Part)
Dim assemblyConnection As New AssemblyConnection(parentSystem, frameConnection, part)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.AssemblyConnection.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.MemberSplitConnection,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.MemberPart,System.String)
member.summary: Creates assembly connection object using the connection information from the given member split connection.
member.param: The parent system under which the assembly connection will be created.
The member part associated with the split connection.
The root selector or part name.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when unable to get a valid assembly connection part.
Raised when the member split connection is not valid.
Raised when the database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
Raised when the root selector is not valid.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while executing the selection rule.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the assembly connection.
Raised when a connection already exists.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create an assembly connection using a member split connection, with resulting member part.
Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim parentSystem As New StructuralSystem(rootSystem)
'Get the member split connection from member system which is split. Dim memberSplitConnection As MemberSplitConnection = memberSystem.SplitConnections(0)
'Get the resulting member part on which side the assembly connection is needed. Dim memberPart As MemberPart = memberSystem.GetPart(MemberAxisEnd.Start)
Dim assemblyConnection As New AssemblyConnection(parentSystem, memberSplitConnection, memberPart, "FrameAsmConnections")

Raised when unable to get a valid assembly connection part.

member.example:
This is an example of how to create an assembly connection using a member split connection, with resulting member part and assembly connection catalog part.
Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim parentSystem As New StructuralSystem(rootSystem)
'Get the member split connection from member system which is splited. Dim memberSplitConnection As MemberSplitConnection = memberSystem.SplitConnections(0)
'Get the resulting member part on which side the assembly connection is needed. Dim memberPart As MemberPart = memberSystem.GetPart(MemberAxisEnd.Start)
'Get the assembly connection part. Dim part As Part = DirectCast(catalogStructHelper.GetPart("BasePlateAsmConn_1"), Part)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.AssemblyConnection.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.MemberPart,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.StructPortBase},System.String)
member.summary: Creates assembly connection object using a bounded member part and bounding ports.
member.param: The bounded member part under which the assembly connection will be created.
The bounding ports, which are also known as penetrated ports. Bounding ports can be ports from member parts, detailed plate parts, and detailed stiffener parts.
The root selector or part name.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when the argument is not valid.
Raised when the marine structure assembly could not be loaded.
Raised when one of the given bounding port type is other than face port.
Raised when the given bounding port not having overlapping geometry with the bounded part.
Raised when the database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating assembly connection.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while setting the bounded and bounding ports.
Raised when the root selector is not valid.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while executing the selection rule.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create an assembly connection using a bounded member part and bounding ports.
'Get the proper bounded member part. Dim boundedPart As MemberPart = Nothing
'Get the bounding face ports from the member part. Dim boundingPort1 As TopologyPort = boundingMemberPart.GetPort(TopologyGeometryType.Face, 2000, 513, ContextTypes.Lateral, 513) Dim boundingPorts As New Collection(Of StructPortBase) boundingPorts.Add(boundingPort1)
Dim assemblyConnection As New AssemblyConnection(boundedPart, boundingPorts, "MemberByMember")

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.AssemblyConnection.ExecuteSelectionRule(System.String)
member.summary: Executes the selection rule on the assembly connection with the given root selection or part. The root selector is set to the catalog item given by the input string.
member.returns: If the input value is a part name the return value is the same part. If the input value is a part class that has an associated selection rule, the return value is the first part selected by the selection rule. If the input value is an empty string, the return value is the first part selected by the selection rule based on the objectâ€™s current root selector.
member.example:
Example for the method ExecuteSelectionRule.
Dim assemblyConnection As AssemblyConnection 'Substitute this line with the actual assembly connection instance. Dim selectionRule As String = assemblyConnection.ExecuteSelectionRule("FrameAsmConnections")
member.exception: Raised if the rootSelectorOrPart argument is null.
Raised when unable to find a valid part under the given root selection. An invalid part is a part which is not a child of the root smart class hierarchy.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while executing the selection rule.

member.name: T:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.Services.SelfOutputAttribute
member.summary: SelfOutputAttribute defined on a custom GeometricConstructionDefinition class defines the self-output parameter. When a GeometricConstructionAssembly is aggregated by another object, the GeometricConstructionAssembly can control some interfaces of its aggregator. The enumeration of the arguments of the GeometricConstruction needs in this case to declare the aggregator as self-output on a set of interfaces described in the array of compute notification interface names.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.Services.SelfOutputAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.Services.SelfOutputAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a SelfOutputAttribute class with the given array of compute notification interface names.
member.param:
The array of compute notification interface names.
Interface names that are declared as input notification interfaces on the GeometricConstructionDefinition. If the input is modified on any of these interfaces, the GeometricConstruction is re-evaluated. If an empty array is given, then a notification is not triggered.
member.exception: Raised if the array of compute notification interface names has a null element.
Raised if the array of compute notification interface names has duplicate objects.
Raised if more than one SelfOutputAttribute is defined in custom GeometricConstructionDefinition.

member.name: P:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.Services.SelfOutputAttribute.NotificationInterfaceNames
member.summary: Gets or sets the notification interface names. This property has been accessed from the GeometricConstructionDefinitionWrapper, any change to signature need to handle in GCDefinitionWrapper also.

member.name: T:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.CoordinateSystem
member.summary: Provides generalization of all entities supporting geometric construction coordinate system-like behavior and functionality.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.CoordinateSystem.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.PrivateBusinessObject)
member.summary: Constructor for .NET to access this class.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.CoordinateSystem.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a transient geometric construction coordinate system occurrence with the geometric construction type name.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurred while creating a geometric construction by type name.

Raised if geometric construction type name is not available in the catalog and disk.
Raised if geometric construction type name is not valid in which to create a geometric construction of type CoordinateSystem.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a transient geometric construction coordinate system occurrence with the geometric construction type name.
Dim geometricConstructionTypeName As String = "CSByLines"
Dim coordinateSystem As New CoordinateSystem(geometricConstructionTypeName)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.CoordinateSystem.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a persistent geometric construction coordinate system occurrence under given parent system and geometric construction type name.
member.param: The parent system under which to create the geometric construction coordinate system.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurred while creating a geometric construction by type name.

Raised if geometric construction type name is not available in the catalog and disk.
Raised if geometric construction type name is not valid in which to create a geometric construction of type CoordinateSystem.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a persistent geometric construction coordinate system occurrence under given parent system and geometric construction type name.
'Get the parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim geometricConstructionTypeName As String = "CSByPoints"
Dim coordinateSystem As New CoordinateSystem(rootSystem, geometricConstructionTypeName)

Y-axis of the Foundation port to be set.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
member.example:
Example code for SetOrientation.
Dim geometricConstructionCoordinateSystem as CoordinateSystem 'Substitute this line with the actual geometric construction coordinate system instance. geometricConstructionCoordinateSystem.SetOrientation(New Vector(1, 0, 0), New Vector(0, 1, 0))

member.name: T:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Stair
member.summary: Stair class definition. Behavior of the Stair class is customized through user attributes using generic property access.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Stair.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.PrivateBusinessObject)
member.summary: Constructor for .NET to access this class.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Stair.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.ReferenceData.Middle.Part,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject)
member.summary: Creates a stair using a top support, bottom plane, and side reference.
member.param: The parent system under which a stair is to be created.
The edge which provides the top support for the stair. The stair top rung is flush with this edge.
The plane which provides the bottom support for the stair.
The edge which provides the side reference for the stair for offset calculations.
member.exception: Raised when the argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred during the creation of stair or ladder.
Raised when the CreateStair method for the stair factory object returned null.
Raised when database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create stair with top support, bottom plane, and side reference.
'Create parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim structuralSystem As New StructuralSystem(plant.RootSystem)
'Create grid system. Dim gridSystem As New GridSystem(structuralSystem, CoordinateSystem.CoordinateSystemType.Grids, New Position(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)) Dim zPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim xPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim yPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim gridCoordinateSystem As CoordinateSystem = gridSystem.GetGridSystem(GridCoordinateTypes.Rectangular, zPlaneInputs, xPlaneInputs, yPlaneInputs)
Dim zAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Z) Dim xAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.X) Dim yAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Y)
'Get the required top support, bottom plane, and side reference. Dim topSupport As GridLine = DirectCast(zAxis.GetPlane(5.0), GridElevationPlane).CreateGridLine(xAxis.GetPlane(5.0)) Dim bottomPlane As GridElevationPlane = zAxis.GetPlane(0.0) Dim sideReference As GridLine = DirectCast(zAxis.GetPlane(5.0), GridElevationPlane).CreateGridLine(yAxis.GetPlane(5.0))
'Get the catalog part. Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper() Dim stairPart As Part = DirectCast(catalogStructHelper.GetPart("StairA1"), Part)
Dim stair As New Stair(structuralSystem, stairPart, topSupport, bottomPlane, sideReference)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Stair.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.ReferenceData.Middle.Part,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject)
member.summary: Creates a stair using a top support and bottom plane.
member.param: The parent system under which a stair is to be created.
The edge which provides the top support for the stair. The stair top rung is flush with this edge.
The plane which provides the bottom support for the stair.
member.exception: Raised when the argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred during the creation of stair or ladder.
Raised when the CreateStair method for the stair factory object returned null.
Raised when database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a stair with top support and bottom plane.
'Create parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim structuralSystem As New StructuralSystem(plant.RootSystem)
'Create grid system. Dim gridSystem As New GridSystem(structuralSystem, CoordinateSystem.CoordinateSystemType.Grids, New Position(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)) Dim zPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim xPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim yPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim gridCoordinateSystem As CoordinateSystem = gridSystem.GetGridSystem(GridCoordinateTypes.Rectangular, zPlaneInputs, xPlaneInputs, yPlaneInputs)
Dim zAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Z) Dim xAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.X) Dim yAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Y)
'Get the required top support and bottom plane. Dim topSupport As GridLine = DirectCast(zAxis.GetPlane(5.0), GridElevationPlane).CreateGridLine(xAxis.GetPlane(5.0)) Dim bottomPlane As GridElevationPlane = zAxis.GetPlane(0.0)
'Get the catalog part. Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper() Dim stairPart As Part = DirectCast(catalogStructHelper.GetPart("StairA1"), Part)
Dim stair As New Stair(structuralSystem, stairPart, topSupport, bottomPlane)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Stair.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Stair)
member.summary: Creates a stair using an existing stair.
member.exception: Raised when the argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred during the creation of stair or ladder.
Raised when the CreateStair method for the stair factory object returned null.
Raised when database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create stair with an existing stair.
'Create a stair which will be copied. Dim stairToCopy As Stair
Dim stair As New Stair(stairToCopy)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Stair.SetInputs(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ICurve,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.IPlane,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ICurve)
member.summary: Uses an edge object for top support and side reference to set the support properties for a stair. Properties cannot be set individually since there are certain combinations of planes and curves that are not allowed.
member.param: The edge which provides the top support for the stair. The stair top rung is flush with this edge.
The plane which provides the bottom support for the stair.
The edge which provides side reference for the stair for offset calculations.
member.exception: Unexpected failure while defining the stair.
member.example:
This is an example of the overloaded SetInputs method which takes an edge object as top support, a plane object as bottom plane, and an edge object as side reference.
'Create a stair using its constructor. oStair.SetInputs(oTopSupportCurve, oBottomPlane, oSideReferenceCurve)

member.name: T:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.Services.GraphicInputBehaviorAttribute
member.summary: GraphicInputBehaviorAttribute is followed by GraphicInput field variables in a custom GeometricConstructionDefinition class. This is used to fully describe a GraphicInputBehavior in a custom GeometricConstructionDefinition.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.Services.GraphicInputBehaviorAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a GraphicInputBehaviorAttribute class with the given graphic input prompt, tooltip, and roles.
member.param: The ResourceID for the prompt of the graphic input behavior that is defined in localizer assembly.
The default prompt of the graphic input behavior in case the promptResourceID is not found in localizer assembly.
The ResourceID for the tooltip of the graphic input behavior that is defined in localizer assembly.
The default tooltip of the graphic input behavior in case the toolTipResourceID is not found in localizer assembly.

The roles show that the input has been provided by the system.
For example, multiple GeometricConstructions might require a CoordinateSystem as input;
- this CoordinateSystem plays a role of ActiveCS, and
- this role name is assigned to the input CoordinateSystem of all these GeometricConstructions.
- After locating the CoordinateSystem the first time for one of these GeometricConstructions, the moniker of the CoordinateSystem associated with the role name is persisted in the value manager.
- Any GeometricConstruction that requires an input CoordinateSystem playing the role of ActiveCS will have the corresponding smart step on the GeometricConstruction ribbon bar pre-filled with this CoordinateSystem (the color of the smart step is blue to show that the input has been provided by the system).
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised if there is more than one GraphicInputBehaviorAttribute found on GraphicInput.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.Services.GraphicInputBehaviorAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a GraphicInputBehaviorAttribute class with the given graphic input prompt, icon, tooltip, ability to enable SmartSketch, point maker ProgID, and roles.

The ResourceID for the tooltip of the graphic input behavior that is defined in the localizer assembly.
The default tooltip of the graphic input behavior in case the toolTipResourceID is not found in localizer assembly.
Boolean indicating whether or not to enable SmartSketch.

The point maker ProgID. If graphic input requires a point for the SmartSketch service to enable.
For example, if locating the cursor near the intersection of 2 lines, the intersection glyph appears, and the system will construct a point by using the PointMaker service.

The roles show that the input has been provided by the system.
For example, multiple GeometricConstructions might require a CoordinateSystem as input;
- this CoordinateSystem plays a role of ActiveCS, and
- this role name is assigned to the input CoordinateSystem of all these GeometricConstructions.
- After locating the CoordinateSystem the first time for one of these GeometricConstructions, the moniker of the CoordinateSystem associated with the role name is persisted in the value manager.
- Any GeometricConstruction that requires an input CoordinateSystem playing the role of ActiveCS will have the corresponding smart step on the GeometricConstruction ribbon bar pre-filled with this CoordinateSystem (the color of the smart step is blue to show that the input has been provided by the system).
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised if there is more than one GraphicInputBehaviorAttribute found on GraphicInput.

member.name: T:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart
member.summary: Generic Plate Part is used to create stand-alone plate parts in assemblies; e.g., a base plate or gusset plane in assembly connections, top plate in frame foundations, etc.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.PrivateBusinessObject)
member.summary: Constructor for .NET to access this class.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.ReferenceData.Middle.Material,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.CustomInput},System.String)
member.summary: Creates a generic plate part with the given material and thickness under the given parent system.
member.param: Parent system under which to create the generic plate part.
Material of the generic plate part.
Thickness of the generic plate part.
Collection of custom input objects, which can be null.
The root selector or part name in the catalog.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when the parent system is not in working status.
Raised when the user does not have permission to access or modify the parent system object.
Raised when the database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the generic plate part.
Raised if there is invalid thickness value.
Raised if an invalid generic plate part type is given.
Raised when unable to find a valid part under the given root selection.
Raised if the custom input collection has a null element.
Raised if the custom input collection has duplicate objects.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a generic plate part with the given material and thickness under the given parent system.
Get the parent system and material. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim parentSystem As New StructuralSystem(DirectCast(rootSystem, BusinessObject)) Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper() Dim material As Material = catalogStructHelper.GetMaterial("Steel - Carbon", "A") Dim rootSelector As String = "GenericRectPlatePart"
Dim genericPlatePart As New GenericPlatePart(parentSystem, material, 0.01, CInt(GenericPlatePartType.BasePlate), Nothing, rootSelector)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart)
member.summary: Creates a generic plate part using an existing generic plate part.
member.param: The generic plate part to be copied.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when the generic plate part to be copied is not in working status.
Raised when the user does not have permission to access or modify the generic plate part to be copied.
Raised when the database connection cannot be obtained from the given generic plate part to be copied.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while creating the generic plate part.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a generic plate part using an existing generic plate part.
'Create a generic plate part which will be copied. Dim genericPlatePartToCopy As GenericPlatePart
Dim genericPlatePart As New GenericPlatePart(genericPlatePartToCopy)

member.summary: Gets a specific port on the given entity with the given port moniker data. Use the flag createPort to get a port with geometry that will be created by a later operation. The port is needed to establish a connection. Typical use is to get the related initial port or stable port.
member.param: ID on the sub port. Also, type of the section face.
Flag to specify the geometry stage.
Flag to create a port with the given moniker data, in case port is not found.
member.returns: Struct port created by the given moniker data.
member.exception: GetPort is not implemented at this time.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart.GetPort(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Feature,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a port with given feature operation and segment ID from the feature. If the createPort argument is true, it will create a late binding port, i.e. a port with no current geometry. Typical use is to get face/edge late binding ports after endcut is applied.
member.param: Flag to create a port with given data in case port is not found.
member.returns: Struct port created by the given moniker data.
member.exception: Raised when an argument is null.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart.GetPort(Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.TopologyGeometryType,Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.ContextTypes)
member.summary: Gets a base or offset port with the given topology geometry type from the given entity. Operation ID, operator ID, and section face ID are ignored for filtering ports.
member.returns: Base or offset port based on the given inputs. Null if no port is available on the entity with the given inputs.
member.exception: Raised if context type is not base or offset.
Raised if the geometry type is not within the TopologyGeometryType enumerator range.
Raised when there is failure to find the port.
Raised when more than one port meets the given criteria.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart.ExecuteSelectionRule(System.String)
member.summary: Executes the selection rule on the generic plate part starting with the given root selection or part. The root selector is set to the catalog item given by the input string.
member.param: The root selector or part name in the catalog.
member.returns: If the input value is a part name the return value is the same part. If the input value is a part class that has an associated selection rule, the return value is the first part selected by the selection rule. If the input value is an empty string, the return value is the first part selected by the selection rule based on the objectâ€™s current root selector.
member.example:
Example for the method ExecuteSelectionRule.
Dim genericPlatePart As GenericPlatePart 'Substitute this line with the actual generic plate part instance. Dim selectionRule As String = genericPlatePart.ExecuteSelectionRule("GenericRectPlatePart")
member.exception: Raised if the rootSelectorOrPart argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while executing the selection rule.
Raised when unable to find a valid part under the given root selection. An invalid part is a part that is not a child of the root smart class hierarchy.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart.GetAvailableSelections(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the available choices of catalog parts or leaf part classes at the given part class level. These choices are based on selection made by the selector rule according to the ProgID specified on the part class in the catalog. Value at index 0 is the current selection. Returns an empty collection if there are no selection rule choices.
member.param: Name of the part class whose selections are needed.
member.returns: Read-only collection of available choices for the part class.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurs while retrieving the selection rule results.
Raised when a failure occurs executing the selection rule.
member.example:
Example for the method GetAvailableSelections.
Dim genericPlatePart As GenericPlatePart 'Substitute this line with the actual generic plate part instance. Dim availableSelections As ReadOnlyCollection(Of String) = genericPlatePart.GetAvailableSelections("GenericRectPlatePart")

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.GenericPlatePart.GetAvailableSelections
member.summary: Returns the available choices of catalog parts or leaf part classes at the parent part class level. Raised if the interface does not exist in the metadata.
Raised if the given role name is not found in the metadata.

Raised when an unexpected error occurred while getting an item from the collection helper.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while setting the references collection argument.

This is an example of how to use the SetInput method.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.Services.GeometricConstructionDefinition.GetReplacingObjects(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject)
member.summary: Returns the collection of objects replacing the given object as a result of an operation; e.g., Split. Call this method inside the InputReplaced implementation to get the collection of objects replacing the indicated input object. An empty collection will be returned if this object is not being replaced.
member.returns: Read-only collection provides the set of BusinessObjects replacing the given replaced object.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurred while getting replacing objects.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.GeometricConstructions.Services.GeometricConstructionDefinition.ReplaceObjects(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject})
member.summary:
Call this method inside the InputReplaced implementation to inform the caller that a set of objects replaces an existing object (split operation), or an object replaces a set of existing objects (merge operation). One of the input collections must contain just one object. If the first collection has one object, it is a split operation; if the second collection has one object then, it is a merge operation.
In most instances, both input collections will have one object which is the same indicating that one object maintains its identity. This is not required, but a typical replacement scenario.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised if either the replaced objects or replacing objects count is more than 1. Currently, replacement of multiple objects with multiple replacing objects is not supported.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurred while setting replaced objects.

member.summary: Call this method inside the InputReplaced implementation to inform the caller that new objects were deleted, and these deleted objects were replaced by another set of objects. One of the input collections must contain only one object. If the first collection has one object, it is a split operation; if the second collection has one object then it is a merge operation.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.

member.summary:
Gets the additional graphical displayable objects from this GeometricConstruction occurrence. An empty collection will be returned for parameters that do not have graphics.
For example, if the required input is a keypoint on a member cross section, it can return a collection of spheres representing keypoints positions in a graphic display. This method can be overridden by the inheriting class if the need exists to get additional graphical displayable objects. By default this method returns an empty collection.
member.returns: Additional graphical displayable objects.
member.exception: Raised when getting additional graphical displayable objects from a custom geometric construction definition that is not a subclass of GeometricConstructionDefinition.

member.name: T:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.WallSystem
member.summary: Wrapper for the wall system. This class is the logical container for a wall part and run. Surface representation of the wall is obtained by extruding the path.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.WallSystem.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.PrivateBusinessObject)
member.summary: Constructor for .NET to access this class.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.WallSystem.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.ReferenceData.Middle.CrossSection,Ingr.SP3D.ReferenceData.Middle.Part,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.IPlane,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.Sketch3D,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a wall system using the Sketch3D path and given wall system part.
member.param: Parent system under which to create the wall system.
Cross section of the wall system.
Supporting plane of the wall system.
Sketch3D path of the wall system.
Cardinal point of the wall system.
member.exception: Raised when the argument is null.
Failed to create the wall factory.
Raised when database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
Failed to create the wall factory.
Unexpected failure occurred while trying to create a WallSystem using Sketch3D.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a wall system using a Sketch3D path and given wall system part.
'Create parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim structuralSystem As New StructuralSystem(plant.RootSystem)
'Create grid system. Dim gridSystem As New GridSystem(structuralSystem, CoordinateSystem.CoordinateSystemType.Grids, New Position(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)) Dim gridCoordinateSystem As CoordinateSystem = gridSystem.GetGridSystem(GridCoordinateTypes.Rectangular, New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0), New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0), New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0)) Dim zAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Z) Dim supportPlane As GridElevationPlane = zAxis.GetPlane(0.0)
'Create and customize the Sketch3D object here. Dim sketch3D As New Sketch3D(plant) Dim sketchPoints As New Collection(Of SketchPoint)() Dim sketchPoint1 As New SketchPoint(0, 0, 0) Dim sketchPoint2 As New SketchPoint(10, 0, 0) Dim sketchPoint3 As New SketchPoint(10, 10, 0) 'Create a line feature between first and second sketch point. Dim lineFeature As LineFeature = sketchPoint1.CreateLineFeature(sketchPoint2) 'Create another line feature between second and third sketch point. lineFeature = sketchPoint2.CreateLineFeature(sketchPoint3) sketchPoints.Add(oSkPt1) sketchPoints.Add(oSkPt2) sketchPoints.Add(oSkPt3) sketch3D.SetSketchPoints(sketchPoints)
'Get the required wall cross section and wall part from catalog. Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper() Dim crossSection As CrossSection = catalogStructHelper.GetCrossSection("Wall Cross-Sections", "Rect", "Rect19""x3.5""") Dim part As Part = DirectCast(catalogStructHelper.GetPart("Clading", "C_Siding_Steel - Carbon_4""_Steel_Framing_2""_Siding_Steel - Carbon_4"""), Part)
Dim wallSystem As New WallSystem(structuralSystem, crossSection, part, supportPlane, sketch3D, 3, False, 1.0, 0.1)

This is an example of how to create a wall system using a Sketch3D path and given wall system type and composition.
'Create parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim structuralSystem As New StructuralSystem(plant.RootSystem)
'Create grid system. Dim gridSystem As New GridSystem(structuralSystem, CoordinateSystem.CoordinateSystemType.Grids, New Position(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)) Dim gridCoordinateSystem As CoordinateSystem = gridSystem.GetGridSystem(GridCoordinateTypes.Rectangular, New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0), New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0), New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0)) Dim zAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Z) Dim supportPlane As GridElevationPlane = zAxis.GetPlane(0.0)
'Create and customize the Sketch3D object here. Dim sketch3D As New Sketch3D(plant) Dim sketchPoints As New Collection(Of SketchPoint)() Dim sketchPoint1 As New SketchPoint(0, 0, 0) Dim sketchPoint2 As New SketchPoint(10, 0, 0) Dim sketchPoint3 As New SketchPoint(10, 10, 0) 'Create a line feature between first and second sketch point. Dim lineFeature As LineFeature = sketchPoint1.CreateLineFeature(sketchPoint2) 'Create another line feature between second and third sketch point. lineFeature = sketchPoint2.CreateLineFeature(sketchPoint3) sketchPoints.Add(oSkPt1) sketchPoints.Add(oSkPt2) sketchPoints.Add(oSkPt3) sketch3D.SetSketchPoints(sketchPoints)
'Get the required wall cross section from catalog. Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper() Dim crossSection As CrossSection = catalogStructHelper.GetCrossSection("Wall Cross-Sections", "Rect", "Rect19""x3.5""")
Dim wallSystem As New WallSystem(structuralSystem, crossSection, "Clading", "C_Siding_Steel - Carbon_4""_Steel_Framing_2""_Siding_Steel - Carbon_4""", supportPlane, sketch3D, 3, False, 1.0, 0.1)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Ladder.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.PrivateBusinessObject)
member.summary: Constructor for .NET to access this class.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Ladder.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.ReferenceData.Middle.Part,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject)
member.summary: Creates a ladder using a top support, bottom plane, and side reference.
member.param: The parent system under which a ladder is to be created.
The edge which provides the top support for the ladder. The ladder top rung is flush with this edge.
The plane which provides the bottom support for the ladder.
The edge which provides side reference for the ladder for offset calculations.
member.exception: Raised when the argument is null.
Raised when unexpected error occurred during the creation of stair or ladder.
Raised when the CreateLadder method for the ladder factory object returned null.
Raised when database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a ladder with top support, bottom plane, and side reference.
'Create parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim structuralSystem As New StructuralSystem(plant.RootSystem)
'Create grid system. Dim gridSystem As New GridSystem(structuralSystem, CoordinateSystem.CoordinateSystemType.Grids, New Position(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)) Dim zPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim xPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim yPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim gridCoordinateSystem As CoordinateSystem = gridSystem.GetGridSystem(GridCoordinateTypes.Rectangular, zPlaneInputs, xPlaneInputs, yPlaneInputs)
Dim zAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Z) Dim xAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.X) Dim yAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Y)
'Get the required top support, bottom plane, and side reference. Dim topSupport As GridLine = DirectCast(zAxis.GetPlane(5.0), GridElevationPlane).CreateGridLine(xAxis.GetPlane(5.0)) Dim bottomPlane As GridElevationPlane = zAxis.GetPlane(0.0) Dim sideReference As GridLine = DirectCast(zAxis.GetPlane(5.0), GridElevationPlane).CreateGridLine(yAxis.GetPlane(5.0))
'Get the catalog part. Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper() Dim ladderPart As Part = DirectCast(catalogStructHelper.GetPart("LadderA1"), Part)
Dim ladder As New Ladder(structuralSystem, ladderPart, topSupport, bottomPlane, sideReference)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Ladder.#ctor(Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.ISystem,Ingr.SP3D.ReferenceData.Middle.Part,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject,Ingr.SP3D.Common.Middle.BusinessObject)
member.summary: Creates a ladder using an top support and bottom plane.
member.param: The parent system under which a ladder is to be created.
The edge which provides the top support for the ladder. The ladder top rung is flush with this edge.
The plane which provides the bottom support for the ladder.
member.exception: Raised when the argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred during the crsation of stair or ladder.
Raised when the CreateLadder method for the ladder factory object returned null.
Raised when database connection cannot be obtained from the given parent system.
member.example:
This is an example of how to create a ladder with top support and bottom plane.
'Create parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim structuralSystem As New StructuralSystem(plant.RootSystem)
'Create grid system. Dim gridSystem As New GridSystem(structuralSystem, CoordinateSystem.CoordinateSystemType.Grids, New Position(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)) Dim zPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim xPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim yPlaneInputs As New GridAxisInputs(0.0, 1.0, 5.0) Dim gridCoordinateSystem As CoordinateSystem = gridSystem.GetGridSystem(GridCoordinateTypes.Rectangular, zPlaneInputs, xPlaneInputs, yPlaneInputs)
Dim zAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Z) Dim xAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.X) Dim yAxis As GridAxis = gridSystem.GetGridAxis(AxisType.Y)
'Get the required top support and bottom plane. Dim topSupport As GridLine = DirectCast(zAxis.GetPlane(5.0), GridElevationPlane).CreateGridLine(xAxis.GetPlane(5.0)) Dim bottomPlane As GridElevationPlane = zAxis.GetPlane(0.0)
'Get the catalog part. Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper() Dim ladderPart As Part = DirectCast(catalogStructHelper.GetPart("LadderA1"), Part)
Dim ladder As New Ladder(structuralSystem, ladderPart, topSupport, bottomPlane)

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Helpers.PartSelectionHelper.ExecuteSelectionRule(System.String)
member.summary: Executes the selection rule on the smart occurrence starting with the given root selection or part. The root selector is set to the catalog item given by the input string.
member.param: The root selector or part name in the catalog.
member.returns: If the input value is a part name the return value is the same part. If the input value is a part class that has an associated selection rule, the return value is the first part selected by the selection rule. If the input value is an empty string, the return value is the first part selected by the selection rule based on the objectâ€™s current root selector.
member.exception: Raised if the rootSelectorOrPart argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected error occurred while executing the selection rule.
Raised when unable to find a valid part under the given root selection. An invalid part is a part which is not a child of the root smart class hierarchy.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Helpers.PartSelectionHelper.GetAvailableSelections(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the available choices of catalog parts or leaf part classes at the given part class level. These choices are based on selection made by the selector rule according to the ProgID specified on the part class in the catalog. Value at index 0 is the current selection. Returns an empty collection if there are no selection rule choices.
member.param: Name of the part class whose selections are needed.
member.returns: Read-only collection of available choices for the part class.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurs while retrieving the selection rule results.
Raised when a failure occurs executing the selection rule.

member.name: M:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Helpers.PartSelectionHelper.GetAvailableSelections
member.summary: Returns the available choices of catalog parts or leaf part classes at the parent part class level. These choices are based on selection made by the selector rule according to the ProgID specified on the parent part class in the catalog. Value at index 0 is the current selection. Returns an empty collection if there are no selection rule choices.
member.returns: Returns the read-only string collection of selections.
member.exception: Raised when an unexpected COM failure occurs while retrieving the selection rule results.
Raised when a failure occurs executing the selection rule.

member.summary: Creates a transient geometric construction topology solid occurrence with the geometric construction type name.
member.exception: Raised if an argument is null.
Raised when an unexpected failure occurred while creating a geometric construction by type name.

This is an example of how to create a persistent geometric construction topology solid occurrence under given parent system and geometric construction type name.
'Get the parent system. Dim plant As Model = MiddleServiceProvider.SiteMgr.ActiveSite.ActivePlant.PlantModel Dim rootSystem As ISystem = plant.RootSystem Dim geometricConstructionTypeName As String = "SolidBy2Planes"
Dim topologySolid As New TopologySolid(rootSystem, geometricConstructionTypeName)

member.name: T:Ingr.SP3D.Structure.Middle.Services.CrossSectionServices
member.summary: Cross-section services class implementation.
Gets the projection surfaces from a cross section along the projection path with the given orientation for the end cap surfaces.
member.param: The cardinal point to be used.
If set to True on the profile, mirrors the cross section.
The rotation angle in radians for the profile.
The start position for vector at cap surface at start.
The normal for cap surface at start.
The end position for the vector at the cap surface at end.
The normal for the cap surface at the end.
Options for creation of surfaces by sweeping a cross section along a path.
member.returns: Projection surfaces from the cross section with the given orientation for the end cap surfaces.
member.exception: Exception raised if an argument is null.
Exception raised if the argument is not within SweepOptions enumerated values.
Exception raised while creating surfaces from a cross section along some given projection path.
member.example:
Example code for using this method.
Dim connection As SP3DConnection = OccurrenceConnection Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper() Dim referenceStandardName As String = "AISC-LRFD-3.1" Dim sectionName As String = "C12x25" Dim crossSection As CrossSection = catalogStructHelper.GetCrossSection(referenceStandardName, sectionName) Dim crossSectionServices As New CrossSectionServices() Dim sweepOptions As SweepOptions = SweepOptions.CreateCaps Dim start As New Position(0, 0, 0), end As New Position(1, 0, 0) Dim startNormal As New Vector(0.0, 1.0, 0.0) Dim endNormal As New Vector(0.0, 0.0, 1.0) Dim line As New Line3d(connection, start, end) Dim surfaces As Collection(Of ISurface) = crossSectionServices.GetProjectionSurfacesFromCrossSection(connection, crossSection, _ line, 4, False, 0, start, startNormal, end, endNormal, sweepOptions)

member.summary: Gets the projection surfaces from a cross section along the projection path with the given orientation for the end cap surfaces.
member.param: The cardinal point to be used.
If set to True on the profile, mirrors the cross section.
The rotation angle in radians for the profile.
The start position for vector at cap surface at start.
The normal for cap surface at start.

member.example:
Example code for using this method.
Dim catalogStructHelper As New CatalogStructHelper() Dim referenceStandardName As String = "AISC-LRFD-3.1" Dim sectionName As String = "C12x25" Dim crossSection As CrossSection = catalogStructHelper.GetCrossSection(referenceStandardName, sectionName) Dim crossSectionServices As New CrossSectionServices() Dim sweepOptions As SweepOptions = SweepOptions.CreateCaps Dim start As New Position(0, 0, 0), end As New Position(1, 0, 0) Dim startNormal As New Vector(0.0, 1.0, 0.0) Dim endNormal As New Vector(0.0, 0.0, 1.0) Dim line As New Line3d(connection, start, end) Dim surfaces As Collection(Of ISurface) = crossSectionServices.GetProjectionSurfacesFromCrossSection( crossSection, _ line, 4, False, 0, start, startNormal, end, endNormal, sweepOptions)
